title: China has passed Europe as Apple's No. 2 market
text: We've rounded up the best deals from Amazon, Walmart, Best Buy, Coach Outlet & more. (Getty Images/Feng Li) China is now Apple's biggest market outside the U.S. In today's earnings report, Apple said that revenue from the Greater China region was $16.8 billion, ahead of Europe, which came in at $12.2 billion. The United States is still the company's biggest region with $21.3 billion in sales. Last quarter, Apple boasted of doubling its Chinese revenues year over year, and said that over 70% of iPhone buyers in China were first-time buyers, meaning the market was not close to saturated yet. Last quarter, China lagged Europe $16.1 billion to $17.4 billion. For all of Apple's 2014 fiscal year, which ended Sept. 30 of last year, China accounted for only $29.8 billion versus $40.9 billion in Europe. WASHINGTON (AP) — Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump drew criticism Friday for posting a video on social media that contains the image of a hog-tied President Joe Biden painted on the tailgate of a passing truck. The Biden campaign was quick to condemn the video for suggesting physical harm to the sitting Democratic president.
